libs.caffe_tensorflow package¶

Submodules¶

libs.caffe_tensorflow.network module¶

This module has a facade for a network. From https://github.com/ethereon/caffe-tensorflow/tree/master/kaffe/tensorflow

class libs.caffe_tensorflow.network.Network(inputs, trainable=True)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

add(*args, **kwargs)¶
avg_pool(*args, **kwargs)¶
batch_normalization(*args, **kwargs)¶
concat(*args, **kwargs)¶
conv(*args, **kwargs)¶
data_path¶

Contains the path to the weights and biases of the network that is going to be loaded for transfer learning

Returns

a string with the path where the weights of the network are stored, if transfer learning is used. The default implementation returns None.

Return type

str

dropout(*args, **kwargs)¶
fc(*args, **kwargs)¶
feed(*args)¶

Set the input(s) for the next operation by replacing the terminal nodes. The arguments can be either layer names or the actual layers.

get_output()¶

Returns the current network output.

get_unique_name(prefix)¶

Returns an index-suffixed unique name for the given prefix. This is used for auto-generating layer names based on the type-prefix.

global_average_pooling(*args, **kwargs)¶
has_transfer_learning¶

Indicates whether or not, transfer learning is going to be used with the model.

Returns

True if the model weights should be loaded from a network previously trained in another dataset. By default it returns False.

Return type

bool

load(data_path, session, train_layers=None)¶

Load network weights. data_path: The path to the numpy-serialized network weights session: The current TensorFlow session train_layers: a list with the names of the layers that are going to be trained. Any other layer that is loaded is going to have its weights, biases and all variables freezed

lrn(*args, **kwargs)¶
make_var(name, shape)¶

Creates a new TensorFlow variable.

max_pool(*args, **kwargs)¶
maybe_load_model(sess: tensorflow.python.client.session.InteractiveSession)¶

This operation allows to load a network in case that transfer learning is used (i.e. loading the weights of a network previously trained in other dataset). If has_transfer_learning property is set to True then the model is model, otherwise no operation is performed.

Parameters

sess – the current Session

Returns

None

relu(*args, **kwargs)¶
setup()¶

Construct the network.

softmax(*args, **kwargs)¶
trainable_layers¶

Contains a list with the names of the layers that are going to be trained. This is useful for transfer learning

Returns

a list. The default implementation returns an empty list

Return type

list

trainable_variables¶

Contains the list of Trainable variables

Returns

the list of Trainable variables. Returns None if has_transfer_learning is set to False, and the list of variables of the layers whose names are in trainable_layers if it’s set to True

Return type

list

validate_padding(padding)¶

Verifies that the padding is one of the supported ones.

libs.caffe_tensorflow.network.layer(op)¶

Decorator for composable network layers.
